item.description: A little bit of a clean-up on the blade, and a first attempt at the dreaded eye lenses. At the most, absolute maximum, only 80% cross-eyed?

Deep in the ugly, patchy phase of it at the moment.

Filling in the remaining white space on the torso. It‚Äôs only when you take the photo that you realise there‚Äôs a fair bit more imprecision than you saw with your Human Eyeball. Fair play to the YouTubers out there getting crispy lines while filming what they‚Äôre up to.

I can‚Äôt remember who originally shared the tip, but if you struggle (like me) to get your non-metallics to actually look ‚Äòshiny‚Äô, you can take a photo of your initial light placement on the mini and just boost the contrast to max and brightness to min. Try to match what you see with paint.

Never painted an elf before, space or otherwise, despite falling in love with Jes Goodwin‚Äôs art back in the day. But this little sculpt is gorgeous.
